Visualize All Individual Insper Colors

Source: R/utils.R
show_insper_colors.Rd

Display all individual named colors (reds1, teals1, etc.) as a visual grid. To extract colors by name for use in plots, use get_insper_colors instead. To see palettes, use show_insper_palette.

Usage

show_insper_colors(color_family = "all")

Arguments

color_family

Optional filter: "all", "reds", "oranges", "magentas", "teals", "grays", "basic". Default "all".

Value

A ggplot2 object showing the colors

Details

This function creates a visual display of individual colors available in the Insper color system. These are atomic color units (like reds1, teals2) that can be extracted using get_insper_colors.

For palette visualization (collections of colors used in scales), use show_insper_palette instead.

See also

get_insper_colors, show_insper_palette, list_palettes

Other colors: get_insper_colors(), get_palette_colors(), insper_pal(), list_palettes(), show_insper_palette()

Examples

# Show all individual colors
show_insper_colors()


# Show only reds
show_insper_colors("reds")


# Show only grays
show_insper_colors("grays")
